p: Glutathione peroxidase (GPX, E.C. 1.11.1.9) activity was analyzed as described by Sharma and Gupta [ 52]. A reaction mixture consisting of 1 mL 0.4 mM phosphate buffer (pH 7.0) containing 0.4 mM EDTA, 1 mL of 5 mM NaN 3, 1 mL of 4 mM glutathione (GSH), and 200 μL of supernatant was pre-incubated at 37 °C for 5 min. Then 1 mL of 4 mM H 2O 2 was inserted and incubated at 37 °C for a further 5 min. The GSH excess was quantified by the 5,5′-dithiobis-2-nitrobenzoic acid (DTNB) method. One unit of GPX is defined as the amount of enzyme required to oxidize for 1 nmol GSH/min. The enzyme specific activity was expressed as units/mg protein.
